subdebateinfo.title: Department of Immigration and Multicultural Affairs: Market Testing Corporate Services
subdebateinfo.subtitle: (Question No. 2683)

talk.start.para: asked the Minister representing the Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs, upon notice, on 9 August 2000:

quote.para: (1) Has the department and/or any agency in the portfolio, set a timeframe to market test any of its corporate services; if so, which agency, which functions, and what is the timeframe.

(2) In relation to each agency which has, or will, move to market test corporate services, what arrangements have been made to consult with effected employees and their representatives; if such arrangements have not been made, when will these consultations be undertaken.

talker.name: Vanstone, Sen Amanda
Senator Vanstone
talker.role: Minister for Justice and Customs

talk.start.para: —The Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs has provided the following answer to the honourable senator's questions:

quote.para: (1) The Department of Immigration and Multicultural Affairs has already outsourced a number of corporate services, including audit, litigation solicitor services, forms, travel, stores, property facilities management, security and banking services. The Department was the lead agency in the first Commonwealth IT outsourcing (Cluster 3) initiative. To test the market, the remainder of the Department's corporate service functions has been categorised into “market groups”. Requests for Tenders (RFTs) for a number of these market groups are currently being prepared. The groups, in the provisional order they are to be market tested, are:
. Accounting Services (RFT to be released early October 2000);
. Office services (RFT to be released early October 2000);
. Personnel Services (RFT to be released January/February 2001);
. Property (RFT to be released June 2001);
. Refreshment of external legal advice panel (timeframe to be determined).
Planning for the market testing of the remainder of corporate services functions is underway.

The Migration Review Tribunal and Refugee Review Tribunal have not commenced market testing of corporate services, due to their pending amalgamation with other Commonwealth merits review tribunals into the Administrative Review Tribunal on 01 February 2001.

(2) Detailed briefings have been held with all corporate services staff in the Department's Central Office and visits to the State and Territory offices have been made. Consultations will continue during the process to ensure staff have a first hand opportunity to express concerns and to contribute productively to the process. Other communications mechanisms are:
. `All Staff' minutes, issued by the Deputy Secretary at regular intervals on current issues and progress;

. A Bulletin Board, accessible by all Departmental staff, has been established, which contains key information on the competitive tendering and contracting (CTC) process. This ensures that the communication of relevant information pertaining to CTC is provided to staff on a regular and timely basis; and

. National Staff Consultative Forum (NSCF) subcommittee: A CTC subcommittee has been formed under the NSCF to discuss issues resulting from the CTC process and how they impact on staff. The NSCF is the chief consultative body for all activities involving departmental employees and their conditions of employment in the Department. The sub-group comprises the Acting Assistant Secretary, CTC Review Taskforce, the Central Office NSCF staff representative, the Community Public Sector Union (CPSU) Industrial Officer and representatives from corporate services areas currently being market tested.
. The CPSU has also been given a detailed initial briefing and further briefings will be provided as necessary.
. Staff from affected areas are being closely involved in the specification of service levels and service standards.

subdebateinfo.title: Department of Immigration and Multicultural Affairs: Market Testing of Functions
subdebateinfo.subtitle: (Question No. 2702)

talk.start.para: asked the Minister representing the Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs, upon notice, on 9 August 2000:

quote.para: (1) Has the department and/or any agency in the portfolio, set a timeframe to market test any of its functions other than corporate services; if so, which agency, which functions, what is the state and city or town location of staff currently undertaking that function, and what is the timeframe.

(2) In relation to each agency which has or will move to market test these functions, what arrangements have been made to consult with effected employees and their representatives; if such arrangements have not been made, when will these consultations be undertaken.

talker.name: Vanstone, Sen Amanda
Senator Vanstone
talker.role: Minister for Justice and Customs

talk.start.para: —The Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs has provided the following answer to the honourable senator's question:

quote.para: (1) The Department of Immigration and Multicultural Affairs has a long-standing record of testing the market for services and delivering services through third parties, and has been managing the provision of services under contract from the private sector for many years. Analysis shows that 69% of all Portfolio resources were under contract, undergoing competitive tendering and contracting (CTC) or fundamental review in March 2000 (63% for departmental resources, and 93% for administered resources).
The Department reviews contracts as they come up for renewal. The Department's major effort with regard to CTC priorities for 2000-01 is focussed on corporate services.
As the identified non-corporate CTC priorities involve renewing current contracts, there is no anticipated impact on departmental staff.

The Migration Review Tribunal and Refugee Review Tribunal have not commenced market testing of non-corporate functions due to their pending amalgamation with other Commonwealth merits review tribunals into the Administrative Review Tribunal on 1 February 2001.
(2) A communication strategy is developed for each market testing exercise as it is undertaken in the Department.
